channel.title: about the mods
channel.description:
ok ive seen mods that im interested on installing but, some are not ready yet, some others have the same idea so i dont know which one is better but the question is... why dont you all work together to bring them as a big badass mod? the reasons
first as i said there are some that are the basic same idea(on a rail, have already two mods that aim to add the "missing" part of the episode) blueshift have two remakes for black mesa two more for the xen episodes(dont know if finished but both are just reskinned original xen maps)
second the time one have to put to just install each episode
third it would be easier if the teams worked together to bring the mods, first because you could use more people that already have things done, second, because you could release the mods quicker
but that is just an idea -_- thanks

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: your-name-here
item.description:
@ the people whose posts I just deleted: Play nice. Don’t be a dick just because you don’t like someone’s question.

Read full topic

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: Dragunov2
item.description:
Crypt19:

Because not everyone wants to play all of them.
Because we don’t all share the same development style or schedule.
Because other reasons that I’m too lazy to list.

Just place a little checker mark which mod u want to install

Read full topic

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: Moop
item.description:
Which mods are doing the same?
I can’t really think of any apart from maybe the sound packs.
All ogf the bigger mods are doing different levels,so why mash everything together?

Read full topic

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: D3lta
item.description:
Bad idea.Like Crypt said, we all got different styles & development schedules.
If everything gets mixed together, I’m pretty sure everything will become a mess.
Not only in-game, but also if there was a group of BM modders.

Read full topic

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: windbladezero
item.description:
i said it because i still dont think we really need two different version of one or another episode, i get what you mean, but still, why would i create a mod alone when someone else is doing the same(in a different way) instead of joining together to make it in less time, with access to more ideas, and since some have said that they study/work, it would a lot to have more people on the project, so it doesnt consumes so much time and so
second, i never said “do not release each mod separately”, i said that it would be great if we could have the mods together, yeah i think i forgot to mention that it could be each one separated but i dont know, on the same page or something, so the users can just go, select the ones they want, or download a full pack or something
not that great of an idea but neither a bad one

Read full topic

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I assume you are talking about all the different Black Mesa mods that have been made since release.

Well, it’s very simple, would you be happy if all the GTA IV mods were put into one giant mod? No. Because it takes away choice from the user. Mods are created to add more choice, not take it away.

Also the Xen mod is a temporary solution, using HL1 assets, while we wait for the real Black Mesa devs to finish their version of the chapters.

Read full topic

item.title: about the mods
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Because not everyone wants to play all of them.
Because we don’t all share the same development style or schedule.
Because other reasons that I’m too lazy to list.

Read full topic
